title: Europe’s future space transport ecosystem
summary: ESA’s future launcher preparatory programme is crafting a space transportation ecosystem, guiding the companies and engineers of today to develop and test the technologies required to meet future needs.

title: A double standard about contamination is keeping us from verifying signs of Martian life
summary:
NASA has announced that the properties of a rock in Jezero Crater qualify as a potential biosignature. The NASA Astrobiology Roadmap defines a biosignature as “an object, substance, and/or pattern whose origin specifically requires a biological agent.” By that standard, a confirmed biosignature would be as close as we can get to proof of alien […]
The post A double standard about contamination is keeping us from verifying signs of Martian life  appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Quantum Space acquires Phase Four propulsion assets
summary:
Quantum Space is acquiring propulsion technologies and facilities from Phase Four to support development of its Ranger maneuverable spacecraft.
The post Quantum Space acquires Phase Four propulsion assets appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: NRO, SpaceX to launch reconnaissance satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The NROL-48 mission will be the fifth mission this year supporting the National Reconnaissance Office’s expansive low Earth orbit statellite constellation it calls the proliferated architecture. Liftoff from pad 4E is scheduled for 10:38 a.m. PDT (1:38 p.m. EDT / 1738 UTC).

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 10-27 mission will be the 280th orbital launch for SpaceX from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. Liftoff from Space Launch Complex 40 is scheduled for 6:53 a.m. EDT (1053 UTC).
